intro: Tithymalus × paradoxus, commonly known as the hybrid tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
